medical_history.chief_complaint: Constant right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain radiating to the shoulder.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient started having flu symptoms and feeling weak over the last few weeks. Over the last 4 days, she developed constant RUQ pain, rating it 7 in severity. She also reported nausea/vomiting and a subjective fever. Her urine has darkened, but there have been no changes in bowel movements.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gestational diabetes, Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, Rheumatic fever as a child, Tonsillectomy as a child, Gallstones, Anxiety, Asthma, Irritable bowel syndrome, Hyperthyroidism secondary to amiodarone therapy.
medical_history.family_history: Patient's mother was diagnosed with an arrhythmia in her time. Her grandmother died at childbirth of a clot in her heart. Her aunt had a valve problem and died before age unspecified.
